comment: Fiery in the nose & pepper in the aftertaste
Strong vanilla, no fire for 105 proof
Light flavor, no caramel or toffee notes

Better than expected. I only picked this up because there were only 6,000 bottles produced (so I bought 3). I'd read some bad and not so bad reviews so I wasn't expecting much. Pleasanty surprised. You can definitely taste the heavy Rye influence. Although I can still taste the vanilla & burnt sugar.
Excellent bourbon. Not harsh at all for 105 proof. Burnt sugar, vanilla and dried fruits. Clean, fresh and light finish.
Very good.  2016 limited release is similar to the new bmh Oregon.   Cinnamon like it was added
Super smooth. Blend of 7 year rye and wheat. Reminiscent of a better basil hayden

3/21/18
Nose: Brown sugar, baking spices, orange zest.
Palate: Caramel candy, orange zest, cinnamon, liquorice. Moderate to heavy alcohol burn
2016 - coats the glass .. thinner taste than it looks.  beam profile with some spice and vanilla.
Really good taste.  Smooth and a little sweet.  100 proof.
Definitely still has its lowbrow spunk, but a nice finish and drinks nice! (2016 vintage)
Very spicy bourbon! Sweet brown sugar and vanilla upon entry. Spices kick in mid pallette thru the long finish. Tobacco and oak as well. Very tasty with a solid burn. Well done.
This is an excellent Bourbon. Dark color, full bodied yes very smooth. I like it!
Exceptional smooth with it’s hints of butterscotch makes it one of my favorites — just wish you could find it in stores.  Don’t pass it up if you should come across it in your travels.
Strong flavor, smooth but powerful bourbon.
Enjoying one of Relic Breweries whiskey flights
